faq.question: How long does the solar roof installation process take?
faq.answer: Physical installation takes 5-10 days for most Easthampton homes. The complete process from consultation to activation spans 8-12 weeks, including custom design, permitting with Easthampton building department, installation, and Eversource interconnection.

faq.question: Why choose Tesla Solar Roof over traditional solar panels?
faq.answer: Tesla Solar Roof provides superior aesthetics that align with Easthampton's creative character, with seamless integration eliminating visible panel mounting. It offers premium roofing protection and maximizes home value. If your roof needs replacement, it combines both investments with better tax benefits.

faq.question: Will solar roof perform well during New England winters?
faq.answer: Absolutely! Solar roofs work effectively year-round in Easthampton. While snow can temporarily reduce output, panels operate more efficiently in cold temperatures. Most Easthampton roofs have adequate pitch for natural snow shedding. Net metering credits summer overproduction for winter consumption.

faq.question: What warranties protect my Easthampton solar roof investment?
faq.answer: Your Easthampton installation includes Tesla's industry-leading 25-year power production warranty, comprehensive manufacturer warranties on all equipment and materials, plus our 10-year workmanship guarantee covering installation quality. Premium roofing materials are engineered for 50+ year lifespan.

faq.question: Can I integrate battery storage with my solar roof?
faq.answer: Yes! Tesla Powerwall battery integration is available and highly recommended for all Easthampton installations. Battery storage enables nighttime solar usage, provides backup power during grid outages, and delivers complete energy independence - perfect for Easthampton's environmentally conscious homeowners.

faq.question: How much energy will my Easthampton solar roof generate?
faq.answer: Energy production varies based on roof size, orientation, pitch, and shading. A typical Easthampton home with an unshaded south-facing solar roof generates 8,000-12,000 kWh annually, covering 80-100% of average household electricity needs. We provide precise production estimates during your free consultation.

faq.question: Do I need to replace my roof before installing solar?
faq.answer: No! Tesla Solar Roof installation includes complete roof replacement as an integral part of the system. If your Easthampton home's roof needs replacement within the next 10-15 years, installing solar roof now makes exceptional financial sense while maximizing available financings and rebates.
